events.title: Peter Minuit Purchases Manhattan
events.description: Peter Minuit, director of the Dutch colony of New Netherland, is credited with purchasing the island of Manhattan from the native Lenape people, marking the beginning of Dutch settlement in the area that would become New York City.
events.significance: This event laid the foundation for the establishment of one of the world's most influential cities.

events.title: Haymarket Affair in Chicago
events.description: A peaceful rally in support of workers striking for an eight-hour workday turned violent when a bomb was thrown at police, resulting in deaths and a controversial trial of labor activists.
events.significance: The Haymarket Affair became a pivotal moment in the labor movement, symbolizing the fight for workers' rights and influencing International Workers' Day.

events.title: The May Fourth Movement in China
events.description: A student-led protest in Beijing against the Treaty of Versailles and foreign imperialism sparked a national movement advocating for modernization and reform in China.
events.significance: This movement profoundly influenced Chinese nationalism and the country's cultural and political landscape in the 20th century.

events.title: Kent State Shootings
events.description: Members of the Ohio National Guard opened fire on unarmed students protesting the Vietnam War at Kent State University, killing four and wounding nine others.
events.significance: The shootings intensified national opposition to the Vietnam War and raised awareness about civil rights and protest in the U.S.
